original_title: CIPM Signs Academic and Professional Cooperation MOU with KAATSU International Uni
original_body_lines: CIPM Sri Lanka – the Nation’s leader in human resource management, signed a Memorandum of Understanding recently with the Faculty of Management of the KAATSU International University, Sri Lanka (KIU) to promote and develop principles, techniques, and practices of human resource management to optimize its utilization at a national and international level by developing collaborative programs and activities. The signing ceremony was held at the CIPM head office, “HR House” in Colombo. Both parties will reap significant benefits under this mutually beneficial academic-professional collaboration.

“We are delighted to be cooperating with KAATSU International University in Sri Lanka in a mutually beneficial manner, including sharing of knowledge and learning resources, conducting of collaborative research, and mutual recognition of and promotion of the qualifications of the two institutions,” said Ken Vijayakumar – President, CIPM Sri Lanka.

Ken Vijayakumar – President, Priyankara Seneviratne – Hony Secretary, Col. S. Jayawickrama (Retired) – Hony Treasurer, UAC Obeysekere – CEO, G Weerathunge – Director – Professional & Academic Affairs, Ms. Himali Dasanayake – Director Operations and CIPM staff represented CIPM Sri Lanka at the ceremony while Dr. Nadeeka Ranadeeva – DeputyVice-Chancellor, Dr. Chandima Sanjeevanie – Hony Dean, Faculty of Management, Ms. Nirmani Samarakoon – Dean, Faculty of Health Sciences, Chamara Lakmal Weerathunga – COO, Ms. Harshani Weerasinghe – Senior Assistant Registrar, Heads of the Departments of Faculty of Management, Academic Staff and students represented the KIU.

Under the terms of the MOU, CIPM will offer a Gold Medal Award and scholarship to the most outstanding student following the Bachelor of Management Honours in HR degree programme at KIU in each batch for each year at the KIU Annual Convocation. CIPM will also offer students and academics at KIU to use its extensive library and e-facilities at no cost, invite KIU academics to participate in lectures, seminars, and conferences conducted by CIPM, and provide exemptions to graduates and undergraduates as per the exemption plan.
